subject: Re: new members
msgSnippet: Perhaps an influx of new members denotes some advertising of Quikscript / Shavian / Reformed Spelling that we have not been aware of. I recall that the
messageBody:
Perhaps an influx of new members denotes some advertising of
Quikscript / Shavian / Reformed Spelling that we have not been aware
of. I recall that the National Spelling Bee took place a little while
ago & that there was an Associated Press article concerning the
history of spelling reform. However, I am doubtful that this one
article alone would draw so many people in.

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "C. Paige Gabhart"
<pgabhart@...> wrote:
>
> This is probably a record: the group has picked up 10 new members in
> the last 15 days. We now have 289 members. I keep thinking we will
> break 300, but every time we get close, I find there are several
members
> whose eemails are bouncing, and I delete them. If you change your
> eemail, don't forget to update your Yahoo eemail so you will
continue to
> get group eemails and know what is happening here.
>
> Tell a friend or two who has the intellectual curiosity to be
excited by
> QS, and we can break that 300 mark easily.
>
> Welcome to our new members: spugnoid, pvandenbrink11, kfs111, rsmalln,
> lebusy, ccradu, raveena346, tim_rice09, futhark2002, and icalway2000.
> If you have special talents (such as programming or other computer
> knowledge) that could help spread the word about QS and improve the
> site, please don't lurk in the background. We can use your help.
Thanks.
>
> Paige
>
